py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search module¶

forward_grid_search.py: Defines a general framework for forward search

through a grid world

py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.segment_length¶

Defines the length of a single grid direction movement. List is organized [L, LU, U, RU, R, RD, D, LD]

Type:

list[float]

class py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.AstarGridSearch(grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, ind_start: int, ind_end: int)¶

Bases: ForwardGridSearch

Defines a cost-wavefront search through the grid

c2c¶

Grid storing the value of the cost to come to each node

Type:

npt.NDArray[Any]

add_index_to_queue(ind_new: int, ind_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶

Adds index to queue based on the cost to come to that new index.

Parameters:

  • ind_new – Index of the new location

  • ind_parent – Index of the parent node

  • direction – The direction from the ind_parent cell to the ind_new cell

cost_to_go_heuristic(ind: int) → float¶

Calculates a heuristic on the cost to go from the index in question

Parameters:

ind – grid index in question

Returns:

Euclidean grid distance from ind to the goal index

Return type:

float

resolve_duplicate(ind_duplicate: int, ind_poss_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶
resolves duplicate sighting of the index - checks to see if the lowest cost to come

to the node has a lower cost-to-come than the previous path found, if so then the cost is updated

Parameters:

  • ind_duplicate – index that has been seen again

  • ind_poss_parent – The possible parent that was seen in index duplicate

  • direction – the direction of the duplicate from the parent

class py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.BreadFirstGridSearch(grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, ind_start: int, ind_end: int)¶

Bases: ForwardGridSearch

Defines a bread-first search through the grid

cost¶

Variable used to implement a FIFO queue. Stores the cost of the next element.

Type:

float

add_index_to_queue(ind_new: int, ind_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶
Adds index purely based on the number of indices in the queue to implement

a FIFO queue

Parameters:

  • ind_new – Index of the new location

  • ind_parent – Index of the parent node

  • direction – The direction from the ind_parent cell to the ind_new cell

Variable used to implement a FIFO queue. Stores the cost of the next element.

add_index_to_queue(ind_new: int, ind_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶
Adds index purely based on the number of indices in the queue to implement

a LIFO queue

Parameters:

  • ind_new – Index of the new location

  • ind_parent – Index of the parent node

  • direction – The direction from the ind_parent cell to the ind_new cell

class py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.ForwardGridSearch(grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, ind_start: int, ind_end: int)¶

Bases: ABC

Defines a general framework for forward search through a grid

grid¶

Occupancy grid over which to search

Type:

BinaryOccupancyGrid

queue¶

The priority queue sorting the active nodes

Type:

SimplePriorityQueue

ind_start¶

The starting index value

Type:

int

ind_end¶

The ending index value for the search

Type:

int

abstract add_index_to_queue(ind_new: int, ind_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶

Adds the index to the queue and store parent

Parameters:

  • ind_new – Index of the new location

  • ind_parent – Index of the parent node

  • direction – The direction from the ind_parent cell to the ind_new cell

calculate_plan_length(plan: list[int] | None = None) → float¶
Calculates the length of a plan. If the plan is not provided then

it is calculated using get_plan with self.ind_end

Parameters:

plan – Optional plan for which the length will be calculated

Returns:

Plan length

Return type:

float

get_plan(end_index: int | None = None) → list[int]¶

Returns a list of indices from the start index to end_index. Assumes that planning has already been performed. Throws a ValueError if the end index cannot be connected to the starting index

Args:

end_index: The index to which to plan. If None, then the plan end index will be used

Returns:

list[int]: Indices of the plan from start to end

resolve_duplicate(ind_duplicate: int, ind_poss_parent: int, direction: GD) → None¶

resolves duplicate sighting of the index - default is to do nothing

Parameters:

  • ind_duplicate – index that has been seen again

  • ind_poss_parent – The possible parent that was seen in index duplicate

  • direction – is the direction of the duplicate from the parent

search() → bool¶

Searches the grid from start to end and returns true if successful

step() → tuple[int, bool]¶

Creates one step through the while loop

Returns:

ind: The index of the node that was visited

-1 => that there are no elements in the queue

succ: true => goal reached, false => it was not

Return type:

tuple[int, bool]

class py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.GD(value)¶

Bases: IntEnum

Define the basic grid directions used for the search

L¶

Left

LU¶

Diagonal, left and up

U¶

Up

RU¶

Diagonal, right and up

R¶

Right

RD¶

Diagonal, right and down

D¶

Down

LD¶

Diagonal, left and down

D = 6¶
L = 0¶
LD = 7¶
LU = 1¶
R = 4¶
RD = 5¶
RU = 3¶
U = 2¶

py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.get_neighboring_nodes(index: int, grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid) → tuple[list[int], list[py_sim.path_planning.forward_grid_search.GD]]¶

Returns a list of neighboring nodes and the resulting directions

Parameters:

  • index – grid index for which the neighbors are returned

  • grid – Occupancy grid defining obstacle locations in the grid

Returns:

list of node indices and corresponding list of directions

Return type:

tuple[list[int], list[GD]]
